name: BSlider
tagline: A simple way to create a slider for Backbone views.
body: ### BSlider A backbone based slider for backbone views. _Note: This is a work in progress. It provides just the basic functionality. Please do not use in production_ #Getting Started Backbone.Slider (BSlider) is built on top of [Backbone.js](http://backbonejs.org). Make sure Backbone is setup in your application, and you have the CSS files for Backbone.Slider. Backbone.Slider uses [Font Awesome](http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/), [jQuery-ui](http://jqueryui.com), and [jQuery](http://jquery.com). Please be sure to include those. ####Backbone.Slider ``` var MySlider = Backbone.Slider.extend({ views: [myBackboneViewOne, myBackboneViewTwo] }); //The Views should be rendered var instance = new MySlider().render(); ``` ####addView instance.addView Add one more view, or an array of views to an instance of the slider. ####Initial View To Be Rendered When the slider is rendered, if you require a specific view to be shown as the first slide, it can be specified as an option. _Future versions will include selecting initial views by name, id, etc._ ``` var MySlider = Backbone.Slider.extend({ initialViewToBeRendered: 1, views: [myBackboneViewOne, myBackboneViewTwo] }); //Index starts at 0 var instance = new MySlider().render(); ``` ###More features coming soon. Stay tuned! ### Author @karun012 ### Support Contact me at karun012@gmail.com if you have any questions/comments/suggestions.
